attributes.action: Stop the proposed development of 30 homes built off Marion Avenue.
attributes.additional_details: I would like the government and parliament to recognise that are greenbelt land is being took away from us. Soon we will be living in a concrete jungle! We need more schools, doctor surgery’s, green spaces and dentists to be built amongst are community.
attributes.background: I would like the government and parliament to recognise that Hucknall simply does not have the infrastructure to handle any more homes being built. It is having a detrimental impact on the environment and surrounding wildlife in the area.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Local planning decisions are a matter for the relevant local authority, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them, by entering your post code here:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

We only reject petitions that don’t meet the petition standards.
